name: bloodhound

procedures: T1018::[BloodHound] can enumerate and collect the properties of domain computers, including domain controllers.
T1033::[BloodHound] can collect information on user sessions.
T1059.001::[BloodHound] can use PowerShell to pull Active Directory information from the target environment.
T1069.001::[BloodHound] can collect information about local groups and members.
T1069.002::[BloodHound] can collect information about domain groups and members.
T1087.001::[BloodHound] can identify users with local administrator rights.
T1087.002::[BloodHound] can collect information about domain users, including identification of domain admin accounts.
T1106::[BloodHound] can use .NET API calls in the SharpHound ingestor component to pull Active Directory data.
T1201::[BloodHound] can collect password policy information on the target environment.
T1482::[BloodHound] has the ability to map domain trusts and identify misconfigurations for potential abuse.
T1560::[BloodHound] can compress data collected by its SharpHound ingestor into a ZIP file to be written to disk.
T1615::[BloodHound] has the ability to collect local admin information via GPO.

description: [BloodHound](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0521) is an Active Directory (AD) reconnaissance tool that can reveal hidden relationships and identify attack paths within an AD environment.(Citation: GitHub Bloodhound)(Citation: CrowdStrike BloodHound April 2018)(Citation: FoxIT Wocao December 2019)
